sponsor.partnerMessage: Dance like no one’s watching. Insulate your attic like it costs nothing. SWEPCO’s Home Performance with ENERGY STAR® Pathway provides no-cost, energy-saving home improvements like attic insulation, air sealing and more. Sign up today to see if you qualify.

posts.title: CACHE and Trike Theatre Team Up to Host Family Day
posts.content:
Get ready for a full day of fun at CACHE Studios on June 4 with a collab between CACHE and Trike Theatre. On top of a fun itinerary, there's no reservation or registration required and the event is free for everyone.

  • More than a show: In addition to the main show, there will be art making activities, sensory play stations, and more.
  • Showtime: At 10am and 12pm there will be dance performances, and then at 1pm Trike Theatre's Mariposa/Butterfly (the main event) will begin.

Check out the itinerary for this fun event here.

posts.title: Region Continues Strong Population Growth
posts.content:
After 24.2% population growth in Northwest Arkansas from 2010 to 2020, the region continued showing strong growth through 2021, topping the Arkansas population charts.

  • Top of the list: Both Bentonville and Benton County grew almost 5% from 2020 to 2021, the fastest city and county wide growth metrics in the state. This makes Bentonville the 28th fastest growing city in the nation with a population over 50,000.
  • Honorable mention: Of the larger cities in Arkansas, Rogers and Fayetteville ranked 3rd and 4th in population growth at 1.9% and 1.8%, behind Bentonville and Conway.

Read the full write-up on the these population estimates here.

posts.title: OZ Fat Tire Kids Crit Ready For Springdale
posts.content:
It was a bummer to have the Fayetteville OZ Kids(TM) Fat Tire Crit event canceled due to weather, but the show will go on! We’re pumped for the next event in Springdale coming up next week! 

  • Kid racers: The OZ Kids Crit in Springdale will take place on June 8. There are seven categories for different age groups from 2-11 years old, and the age of the riders will determine the number of laps in each race.
  • To the finish: Each race is $20, and the fun is priceless. And as always, costumes are encouraged for all riders and volunteers, and the best costume will get a prize! 

Learn more and register for a Springdale race HERE, and get ready to have a blast!

posts.title: Bentonville Named as one of the Top Mountain Towns
posts.content:
Adding to NWA's rapidly growing list of regional accolades, Bentonville was recently named one of the top mountain towns in the US by Outside Magazine.

  • Good company: On the list were well known vacation destinations such as Taos, Sedona, Park City, and others. Ranked 15th on the list and with peers like this, its just another example of NWA gaining recognition on a national scale.
  • The factors: The region has garnered worldwide attention from mountain bikers for its natural topology combined with hundreds of miles of pristinely built trails. Additionally, Bentonville has a thriving arts and culture scene that could easily rival any other town on this list.

Read what Outside had to say about Bentonville and its peers on the list here.

posts.title: Simple+Sweet Founder Partners with Transfix to Further Alleviate Child Hunger
posts.content:
With catering fees paid for by Transfix, one of the the attending companies at Freightwaves' Future of Supply Chain conference, Simple+Sweet was able to feed more than 5,000 families in Northwest Arkansas.

  • Staying busy: Coleman Warren, Simple+Sweet's founder, has been keeping busy since he started the mobile ice cream company. He has since graduated from the U of A with a dual industrial engineering and political science degree, was recognized as a Rhodes Scholar, and is getting married this summer. He has done all this while staying focused on combating child hunger in NWA.
  • Event-Full: With an eye on sustainability, Transfix knew it wanted to partner with a local "superhero" to make an impact on the region during the first Future of Supply Chain conference. Knowing that Warren uses Simple+Sweet proceeds to combat food insecurity, Transfix invited him to cater ice cream at the event while the Company paid the tab.

Read the feel-good story here or read more about Simple+Sweet here.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Tacos and tequilas: Looking for a date night Thursday? Check out this amazing happy hour at Mount Sequoyah.
  • At play: Don't miss the new show coming to TheatreSquared. Tickets are available now and the show starts tomorrow!
  • Home stretch: The Naturals have a 6 game series at home this week with fun fan events like Star Wars night.
  • New brew: Ivory Bill Brewing released its new Restoration Kernza Ale, a first of its kind in Arkansas
  • Good times: The Fayetteville Public Library released a jam packed June events calendar.
  • Glow up: Go get your glow on with the Bentonville Glow Run set for June 3.
  • Tell it: Have a story? We have room in the newsletter for you! Check out our deals HERE.
